com.spazedog.lib.rootfw3

Class RootFW

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spazedog.lib.rootfw3.RootFW
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    InstanceExtender.InstanceRootFW

    public class RootFW
extends java.lang.Object
    Example:
     RootFW root = new RootFW();
 
 if (root.connect()) {
     ...
     
     root.disconnect();
 }

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RootFW.Config
      A static configuration class where some configs can be changed for the framework.
      static class  RootFW.ExtenderGroupTransfer
      This class is used by RootFW when getting new instances of ExtenderGroup classes.

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • rootInstance

        public static InstanceExtender.Instance rootInstance()
        Get an root instance of RootFW.
        This instance is globally shared instance. If no connection is currently opened, a new instance is created and a connection is auto established. Otherwise, the current instance is returned.
        This makes it possible for multiple classes and methods to share the same shell connection.
        Returns:
        A new InstanceExtender.Instance containing the shared shell connection

      • userInstance

        public static InstanceExtender.Instance userInstance()
        Get an user instance of RootFW.
        This instance is globally shared instance. If no connection is currently opened, a new instance is created and a connection is auto established. Otherwise, the current instance is returned.
        This makes it possible for multiple classes and methods to share the same shell connection.
        Returns:
        A new InstanceExtender.Instance instance containing the shared shell connection

      • connect

        public java.lang.Boolean connect()
        Establish a connection to the shell
        Returns:
        True on successful connection

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Close the connection to the shell

      • isConnected

        public java.lang.Boolean isConnected()
        Check whether a shell connection has been established
        Returns:
        True if the connection is open

      • isRoot

        public java.lang.Boolean isRoot()
        Check whether this shell is a root shell or a reglar user shell
        Returns:
        True if this is a root shell

      • shell

        public ShellExtender.Shell shell()
        Return a new ShellExtender.Shell instance which can be used to communicate with the shell.
        See Also:
        ShellExtender.Shell

      • shell

        public java.lang.String shell(java.lang.String command)
        This is a quick shell executer, which can be used for small fast shell work. It allows you to execute one single command, and then returns the last line of the output.
        Example:
        String line = rootfwInstance.shell("df -h /dev/block/mmcblk0p1");
        Parameters:
        aRoot - Whether to connect as root or as a regular user
        Returns:
        The last line of the shell output

      • file

        public FileExtender.File file(java.lang.String file)
        Return a new instance of the FileExtender.File class for the file defined in the argument.
        Note that this method keeps track of already existing instances. This means that if an instance already exist with the same file (If it is being stored in another variable and therefore not yet been GC'd), a reference to the same instance is returned instead.
        See Also:
        FileExtender.File

      • memory

        public MemoryExtender.Memory memory()
        Return a new instance of the MemoryExtender.Memory class.
        See Also:
        MemoryExtender.Memory

        Note that this method keeps track of already existing instances. This means that if an instance already exist with the same file (If it is being stored in another variable and therefore not yet been GC'd), a reference to the same instance is returned instead.
        See Also:
        MemoryExtender.Device

      • filesystem

        public FilesystemExtender.Device filesystem(java.lang.String device)
        Return a new FilesystemExtender.Device instance which can be used to alter a device mount state, get mount information etc.
        Parameters:
        device - The device or mount location to work with
        Returns:
        A new FilesystemExtender.Device instance

      • busybox

        public BinaryExtender.Busybox busybox()
        Return a new instance of the BinaryExtender.Busybox class set for the first busybox binary in the PATH environment variable.
        Note that this method keeps track of already existing instances. This means that if an instance already exist with the same file (If it is being stored in another variable and therefore not yet been GC'd), a reference to the same instance is returned instead.
        See Also:
        BinaryExtender.Busybox, busybox(String)

      • busybox

        public BinaryExtender.Busybox busybox(java.lang.String binary)
        Return a new instance of the BinaryExtender.Busybox class set for the defined busybox binary.
        Note that this method keeps track of already existing instances. This means that if an instance already exist with the same file (If it is being stored in another variable and therefore not yet been GC'd), a reference to the same instance is returned instead.
        See Also:
        BinaryExtender.Busybox, busybox()

      • process

        public ProcessExtender.Process process(java.lang.String process)
        Return a new instance of the ProcessExtender.Process class set for the defined process.
        Note that this method keeps track of already existing instances. This means that if an instance already exist with the same process (If it is being stored in another variable and therefore not yet been GC'd), a reference to the same instance is returned instead.
        See Also:
        ProcessExtender.Process

      • process

        public ProcessExtender.Process process(java.lang.Integer pid)
        Return a new instance of the ProcessExtender.Process class set for the defined process.
        Note that this method keeps track of already existing instances. This means that if an instance already exist with the same process id (If it is being stored in another variable and therefore not yet been GC'd), a reference to the same instance is returned instead.
        See Also:
        ProcessExtender.Process

       java.lang.String aMsg,
       java.lang.Integer aLevel)
        See Also:

      • log

        public static void log(java.lang.String tag,
       java.lang.String msg,
       java.lang.Integer level,
       java.lang.Throwable e)
        This method is used to add logs to the logcat. Unlike using logcat directly, this method is controlled using RootFW.Config.LOG, which determines whether or not to display a log, and which types to display.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag to use in logcat
        msg - The message to send to logcat
        level - The log level defined by RootFW.E_*
        e - A Throwable instance
